clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Prevenar® to Pneumo 23 in Reducing Carriage in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Long-Term Efficacy of Pneumococcal Conjugate 7-Valent Vaccine Versus Plain Polisaccharide Pneumococcus Vacine in Reducing Pneumococcal Nasopharyngeal Carriage of Children.

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the ability of Prevnar® to Pneumo® 23 in reducing and preventing nasopharyngeal carriage of vaccine-type pneumococci one year after respective immunization. To evaluate the rate of penicillin-resistant pneumococci in nasopharyngeal carriage.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will require 6 months to be completed (3 months for nasopharyngeal samples collection; 3 months dor analysis). Each child will participate for a 1 day period.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare the ability of Prevnar® to Pneumo® 23 in reducing and preventing nasopharyngeal carriage of vaccine-type pneumococci one year after respective immunization.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the rate of penicillin-resistant pneumococci in nasopharyngeal carriage.

intervention.intervention_name: pneumococcus conjugate vaccine 7 valent to reduce carriage
intervention.description: plain polisacaride vaccine 23 valent to reduce carriage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy children between
- 2 to 9 years old.
- No history of antibiotic use prior 1 month of enrollment
- No history of invasive pneumococcal disease
